default_question: Describe in detail how your organization utilizes response plans to direct activities during a security incident.

category_statement: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. external support from law enforcement agencies).
control_statement: Personnel know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization communicates to personnel their roles and order of operations when a response is needed.

category_statement: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. external support from law enforcement agencies).
control_statement: Incidents are reported consistent with established criteria
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization ensures events are reported consistent with established criteria.

category_statement: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. external support from law enforcement agencies).
control_statement: Information is shared consistent with response plans
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization shares security incident information consistent with response plans.

category_statement: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. external support from law enforcement agencies).
control_statement: Coordination with stakeholders occurs consistent with response plans
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization ensures coordination with stakeholders is performed consistent with response plans.

category_statement: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. external support from law enforcement agencies).
control_statement: Voluntary information sharing occurs with external stakeholders to achieve broader cybersecurity situational awareness
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization ensures voluntary information sharing occurs with external stakeholders to achieve broader cybersecurity situational awareness.

category_statement: Analysis is conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities.
control_statement: Notifications from detection systems are investigated
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization investigates alerts generated from detection systems.

category_statement: Analysis is conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities.
control_statement: The impact of the incident is understood
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization has processes in place to understand the impact of the security incident.

category_statement: Analysis is conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities.
control_statement: Forensics are performed
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization has processes in place to perform forensic activities during a security incident.

category_statement: Analysis is conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities.
control_statement: Incidents are categorized consistent with response plans
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization has processes in place to categorize an security incident.

category_statement: Analysis is conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities.
control_statement: Processes are established to receive, analyze and respond to vulnerabilities disclosed to the organization from internal and external sources (e.g. internal testing, security bulletins, or security researchers)
default_question: Describe in detail the processes your organization uses to receive, analyze and respond to vulnerabilities disclosed.

category_statement: Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event, mitigate its effects, and resolve the incident.
control_statement: Incidents are contained
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization has processes in place to contain a security incident.

category_statement: Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event, mitigate its effects, and resolve the incident.
control_statement: Incidents are mitigated
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization has processes in place to mitigate a security incident.

category_statement: Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event, mitigate its effects, and resolve the incident.
control_statement: Newly identified vulnerabilities are mitigated or documented as accepted risks
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization has processes in place to mitigate or document newly identied vulnerabilities as accepted risks.

category_statement: Organizational response activities are improved by incorporating lessons learned from current and previous detection/response activities.
control_statement: Response plans incorporate lessons learned
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization has processes in place to ensure lessons learned are incorporated into response plans.

category_statement: Organizational response activities are improved by incorporating lessons learned from current and previous detection/response activities.
control_statement: Response strategies are updated
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization has processes in place to ensure response plans and strategies are updated on a routine basis.

category_statement: Recovery processes and procedures are executed and maintained to ensure restoration of systems or assets affected by cybersecurity incidents.
control_statement: Recovery plan is executed during or after a cybersecurity incident
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization utilizes recovery plans to direct activities when recovering or restoring from a security incident.

category_statement: Recovery planning and processes are improved by incorporating lessons learned into future activities.
control_statement: Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization has processes in place to ensure lessons learned are incorporated into recovery plans.

category_statement: Recovery planning and processes are improved by incorporating lessons learned into future activities.
control_statement: Recovery strategies are updated
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization has processes in place to ensure recovery plans and strategies are updated on a routine basis.

category_statement: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties (e.g.  coordinating centers, Internet Service Providers, owners of attacking systems, victims, other CSIRTs, and vendors).
control_statement: Public relations are managed
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization has processes in place to manage relations with the public and communicate to them when appropriate.

category_statement: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties (e.g.  coordinating centers, Internet Service Providers, owners of attacking systems, victims, other CSIRTs, and vendors).
control_statement: Reputation is repaired after an incident
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization has processes in place to manage reputation with the public and repair any damage when it comes to reputation.

category_statement: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties (e.g.  coordinating centers, Internet Service Providers, owners of attacking systems, victims, other CSIRTs, and vendors).
control_statement: Recovery activities are communicated to internal and external stakeholders as well as executive and management teams
default_question: Describe in detail how your organization has processes in place to communicate recovery activities to all internal stakeholders, executives and management.
